meanings.definition: A person who is dishonest or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: The sleazo tricked his friends into giving him money.
meanings.sent2: I heard that sleazo is not to be trusted.
meanings.sent3: The sleazo tried to sell fake watches on the street.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the sleazo in the neighborhood, always up to no good.
meanings.sent5: The sleazo's sly smile revealed his true intentions.

meanings.definition: To behave in a dishonest or untrustworthy manner.
meanings.sent1: She decided to sleazo her way out of the situation.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to sleazo his customers for more money.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to sleazo its way into the treat jar.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to sleazo his opponents during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The student attempted to sleazo his teacher by cheating on the test.
